intro: Polyscias nossibiensis, commonly known as the Nossibí fern, is a member of the Araliaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a shrub-like plant characterized by its large, lobed leaves that often have a velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels, which are followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
